page.title: 14RASHFIELD SCHOOL.
page.content: This small two teacher, rural school was built about 1890. The original building consisted of 1 classroom and later this was divided into 2. A portacabin was erected in 1975 and was replaced in 1980 by a new extension to the original building. It consisted of a classroom, staffroom, toilets, servery and cloakroom. A tarmac playground was also provided. The new extension has meant better working conditions for staff and pupils. The playground is more suitable than mud or grass although there is still grass and wooded areas as well. The school roll has been down to 7 in 1964 and 1968 and there was talk of the school being closed. At present there are 42 pupils rising to 45 or 46 in session 1985-86.
